articles.author: Sk
articles.description:
7 days in. 7 days of deep work. And OOP nearly killed my project.
The wildest part? I love OOP. I feel a bit betrayed.
Just last week, I wrote three articles celebrating the elegance of "alive" objects—how beautiful it is when data and behavior live in one composite.
So when I saw this tweet, I felt it—because I lived it.

OOP is the reason version 2 of my project exists…

It got so messy I couldn’t fix it.
So yeah, think twice before going full OOP on a large project.
At the moment I work in Go, a composition-first, interface-driven, lean and predictable. It’s great.
But then I decided to build a UI framework in C++, "C with Classes."
hell yeah, baby! OOP time.
I don’t feel that way anymore.
Until you build a decent-sized project in a strongly typed OOP language, OOP feels like the promis…
articles.title: Read This Before OOP-ing Your Project : The Curse of Inheritance.

articles.author: Sindhuja N.S
articles.description:
In today’s fast-paced world of software development, scalability, automation, and high availability are not optional — they’re essential. Kubernetes (often abbreviated as K8s) has become the go-to solution for container orchestration, enabling teams to deploy, scale, and manage applications efficiently in cloud-native environments.
In this blog, we'll explore the core fundamentals of Kubernetes and why it's revolutionizing the way applications are deployed and managed.
🚢 What Is Kubernetes?
Imagine having 100+ containers running various services — Kubernetes acts like the control tower ensuring they’re healthy, balanced, and easily scalable.
🔧 Key Concepts & Components
Pod
The smallest deployable unit in Kubernetes.
A Pod can contain one or more tightly coupled containers that share the …
articles.title: Kubernetes Fundamentals: A Beginner’s Guide to Modern Container Orchestration

articles.author: Illia Kuzmenko
articles.description:
Hi DEV community 👋
I’ve been building analytics tools with frequent TON smart contract calls and want to improve performance — especially latency and throughput.
We’re exploring:
Batching RPC calls
Implementing caching layers
RPC pooling or dedicated nodes
Our team at [EvaCodes] is researching best practices. If you’ve optimized smart contract workflows or integrated TON in production, I’d love to hear about:
Libraries or tools that helped
Architectural patterns or pitfalls
Comparative insights (TON vs Ethereum, etc.)
Thanks in advance! 😊
articles.title: Building High-Performance Web3 Infrastructure @ EvaCodes

articles.author: Alex Costa
articles.description:
Understanding SaaS Funnel Optimization Through AI


The modern SaaS landscape demands smarter approaches to customer acquisition and conversion. Traditional funnel optimization methods often miss subtle user behavior patterns that could dramatically improve conversion rates. An artificial intelligence developer brings advanced analytics and automation capabilities that transform how SaaS companies understand and optimize their customer journey.
Recent industry data shows that SaaS companies using AI-powered funnel optimization see an average 23% increase in conversion rates within six months. This improvement comes from AI's ability to process massive amounts of user data and identify optimization opportunities that human analysts might overlook.
The integration of AI development tools int…
articles.title: Optimize Your SaaS Funnel with AI Developer

articles.author: selfdb
articles.description:
SelfDB – Ditch Supabase and Firebase Lock-In, Self-Host Simply   Hello devs, 
We're a small team of developers who, like many of you, love the power and convenience of Backend-as-a-Service (BaaS) platforms. However, we've also felt the sting of vendor lock-in, wrestled with the complexities of self-hosting feature-rich open-source alternatives, and worried about unpredictable costs or the sudden disappearance of free tiers that many indie devs and small projects rely on. 
We believe developers deserve more control and simplicity without sacrificing functionality. After countless hours spent navigating these challenges, we decided to build the solution we wished existed. 
So, we built SelfDB: a self-hosted, open-source alternative to platforms like Supabase or Firebase. SelfDB provides a Po…
articles.title: SelfDB – Ditch Supabase and Firebase Lock-In, Self-Host Simply

articles.author: deepika0614
articles.description:
The Unstoppable Rise of AI: A 2025 Perspective



Artificial Intelligence has been the defining technological revolution of our time, with its growth trajectory in recent years being nothing short of extraordinary. As we navigate through 2025, let's examine the key factors driving this unprecedented expansion and what it means for our future.
Our analysis reveals three critical indicators of AI's rapid advancement:
Public Interest: Searches for AI-related terms have grown exponentially since 2020
Research Output: The number of AI research papers published has skyrocketed
Startup Ecosystem: New AI startups are emerging at an accelerating pace
Transformers, diffusion models, and other architectures have revolutionized what's possible with AI, enabling applications that were science fiction just a few years ago.
Advancements in hardware, particularly GPUs and TPUs, have made training large models more accessible than ever before.
The digital transformation of society has created vast amounts of training data, fueling more capable AI systems.
Productivity: AI is automating complex tasks across industries
Creativity: New tools are augmenting human creativity in art, music, and writing
Science: AI is accelerating scientific discovery in fields from medicine to materials science
As we look to the future, we can expect:
More powerful and efficient models
Tighter integration with everyday tools
New ethical frameworks and regulations
Continued transformation of the job market
The rise of AI shows no signs of slowing down. While challenges remain, the potential benefits to society are immense. The key will be guiding this technology's development responsibly to ensure it benefits all of humanity.
This analysis was generated using Python. You can find the code here.
Let me know your thoughts on AI's rapid development in the comments below! What aspect of AI excites or concerns you the most?
articles.title: The Unstoppable Rise of AI: A 2025 Perspective

articles.description:
Every once in a while, a new wave of tools comes along that makes you question how you ever coded without them. The latest generation of AI developer tools fits that category perfectly. They autocomplete full functions, review your pull requests, generate test cases, refactor legacy codebases, and even spin up full-stack apps with minimal input. If it feels like cheating — well, it kind of is.
But it’s not magic. It’s just that good.
⚡ Pro Tip: If you're working with APIs, Apidog is the all-in-one tool you shouldn’t ignore. It combines API documentation, testing, mocking, and debugging into a single workspace — like Postman, Swagger, and Notion had a dev-focused baby. Whether you're building or collaborating, it’s got your back.

We’re not just talking about convenience — we’re talking abo…
articles.title: These 10 AI Coding Tools Feel Like Cheating (But They’re Just That Good)

articles.author: Ricardo Chavarria
articles.description:
Si has estado siguiendo la evolución de Angular, sabrás que cada nueva versión trae consigo mejoras y optimizaciones. Pero de vez en cuando, llega una versión que no es solo una actualización, sino un verdadero punto de inflexión. Angular 20 es una de esas versiones, y trae consigo la promoción oficial a Developer Preview de una de las características más esperadas y transformadoras: la ejecución de aplicaciones sin Zone.js.
¿Por qué tanto revuelo? Porque aunque no está listo para producción, nos invita a probar un cambio fundamental en cómo Angular gestiona la detección de cambios, abriendo la puerta a un rendimiento sin precedentes y a un código más explícito y predecible.
En este artículo, vamos a desglosar qué significa "zoneless", por qué es una revolución y cómo puedes empezar a expe…
articles.title: Angular 20 y el futuro sin Zone.js: La revolución "Zoneless" ha llegado (a Developer Preview)

articles.author: Ruqaiya Beguwala
articles.description:
Introduction


When working with Git, you might accidentally stage files you didn't mean to include in your next commit. The git rm --cached command helps you remove files from the staging area while keeping them in your working directory.
git rm --cached?


The git rm --cached command removes files from Git's staging area (index) but keeps them in your local working directory. This is useful when:  
You accidentally staged files you didn’t mean to (git add mistakes).

You want to untrack a file but keep it locally.

You need to remove files from version control without deleting them.




  
  
  Basic Syntax





git rm --cached <file>

git rm --cached (With Examples)



  
  
  Scenario 1: Accidentally Staged a File


You ran git add . and accidentally staged config.json, which contains …
articles.title: Day 20/30 - Git rm --cached: Remove Files from Staging but Keep Locally

articles.author: sergio
articles.description:
Si quieres agregar código JavaScript en tu sitio WordPress pero no te sientes cómodo editando archivos del tema o del servidor, una solución sencilla y segura es usar plugins especializados para insertar JavaScript. Estos plugins te permiten añadir scripts fácilmente, sin tocar código directamente ni poner en riesgo la estabilidad de tu web.
¿Por qué usar plugins para insertar JavaScript?
Facilidad: No necesitas conocimientos avanzados de programación ni acceder a los archivos del servidor.
Seguridad: Evitas errores comunes que pueden romper tu sitio, ya que el plugin se encarga de gestionar el código correctamente.
Flexibilidad: Puedes agregar JavaScript en el encabezado (header), pie de página (footer) o en áreas específicas según el plugin.
Control: Algunos plugins ofrecen opciones para activar o desactivar scripts según páginas, dispositivos o usuarios.
Algunos plugins populares para insertar JavaScript
Insert Headers and Footers: Permite añadir código en el header o footer de forma rápida y sencilla.
Header and Footer Scripts: Similar al anterior, con opciones para scripts personalizados.
WPCode – Insert Headers and Footers + Custom Code Snippets: Ofrece gestión avanzada de fragmentos de código, con soporte para JavaScript, CSS, HTML y PHP.
¿Cómo usar un plugin para insertar JavaScript?
Instala y activa el plugin desde el repositorio oficial de WordPress.
Accede al área de configuración del plugin.
Copia y pega el código JavaScript que quieres insertar en la sección correspondiente (header o footer).
Guarda los cambios y verifica que el script funcione correctamente en tu web.
Este método es ideal para añadir scripts de seguimiento, chatbots, animaciones o cualquier funcionalidad que requiera JavaScript sin complicaciones.
Para una guía paso a paso más detallada y ejemplos de plugins, te recomiendo visitar este artículo:
Cómo insertar JavaScript en WordPress con plugins
articles.title: Cómo insertar JavaScript en WordPress usando plugins

articles.author: sergio
articles.description:
JavaScript es uno de los lenguajes de programación más importantes y utilizados en el desarrollo web moderno. Pero, ¿sabías cómo y cuándo comenzó todo? En este artículo te resumo la fascinante historia de JavaScript.
JavaScript fue creado en 1995 por Brendan Eich, mientras trabajaba en Netscape Communications. Originalmente llamado Mocha y luego LiveScript, su objetivo era permitir interactividad en las páginas web, algo revolucionario para la época. En solo 10 días, Eich desarrolló la primera versión de JavaScript, que se integró en el navegador Netscape Navigator.
Desde entonces, JavaScript ha evolucionado enormemente. Inicialmente fue criticado por sus limitaciones y diferencias entre navegadores, pero su estandarización a través de ECMAScript y el apoyo de la comunidad hicieron que se convirtiera en un pilar para el desarrollo web. Hoy, con frameworks y librerías como React, Angular y Node.js, JavaScript no solo se usa en navegadores sino también en servidores, aplicaciones móviles y mucho más.
Este recorrido histórico nos muestra cómo JavaScript pasó de ser un simple lenguaje de scripting a una herramienta fundamental que impulsa gran parte de la experiencia web actual.
articles.title: La historia de JavaScript: origen y evolución de un lenguaje esencial
